org.apache.twill.filesystem
Interface Location

public interface Location

This interface defines the location and operations of a resource on the filesystem.

Location is agnostic to the type of file system the resource is on.

Field Summary
static String TEMP_FILE_SUFFIX
          Suffix added to every temp file name generated with getTempFile(String).

boolean exists()
               throws IOException
Checks if the this location exists.

Returns:
true if found; false otherwise.
Throws:
IOException

getName

String getName()
Returns:
Returns the name of the file or directory denoteed by this abstract pathname.

createNew

boolean createNew()
                  throws IOException
Atomically creates a new, empty file named by this abstract pathname if and only if a file with this name does not yet exist.

Returns:
true if the file is successfully create, false otherwise.
Throws:
IOException

getOutputStream

OutputStream getOutputStream(String permission)
                             throws IOException
Creates an OutputStream for this location with the given permission. The actual permission supported depends on implementation.

Parameters:
permission - A POSIX permission string.
Returns:
An OutputStream for writing to this location.
Throws:
IOException - If failed to create the OutputStream.

append

Location append(String child)
                throws IOException
Appends the child to the current Location.

Returns a new instance of Location.

Parameters:
child - to be appended to this location.
Returns:
A new instance of Location
Throws:
IOException

getTempFile

Location getTempFile(String suffix)
                     throws IOException
Returns unique location for temporary file to be placed near this location. Allows all temp files to follow same pattern for easier management of them.

Parameters:
suffix - part of the file name to include in the temp file name
Returns:
location of the temp file
Throws:
IOException

toURI

URI toURI()
Returns:
A URI for this location.

delete

boolean delete()
               throws IOException
Deletes the file or directory denoted by this abstract pathname. If this pathname denotes a directory, then the directory must be empty in order to be deleted.

Returns:
true if and only if the file or directory is successfully delete; false otherwise.
Throws:
IOException

delete

boolean delete(boolean recursive)
               throws IOException
Deletes the file or directory denoted by this abstract pathname. If this pathname denotes a directory and recursive is true, then content of the directory will be deleted recursively, otherwise the directory must be empty in order to be deleted. Note that when calling this method with recursive = true for a directory, any failure during deletion will have some entries inside the directory being deleted while some are not.

Parameters:
recursive - Indicate if recursively delete a directory. Ignored if the pathname represents a file.
Returns:
true if and only if the file or directory is successfully delete; false otherwise.
Throws:
IOException

renameTo

@Nullable
Location renameTo(Location destination)
                  throws IOException
Moves the file or directory denoted by this abstract pathname.

Parameters:
destination - destination location
Returns:
new location if and only if the file or directory is successfully moved; null otherwise.
Throws:
IOException

mkdirs

boolean mkdirs()
               throws IOException
Creates the directory named by this abstract pathname, including any necessary but nonexistent parent directories.

Returns:
true if and only if the renaming succeeded; false otherwise
Throws:
IOException

isDirectory

boolean isDirectory()
                    throws IOException
Checks if this location represents a directory.

Returns:
true if it is a directory, false otherwise.
Throws:
IOException

list

List<Location> list()
                    throws IOException
List the locations under this location.

Returns:
Immutable List of locations under this location. An empty list is returned if this location is not a directory.
Throws:
IOException
